title: Abrar A. Alamoudi BDS, MSD, Dipl. ABOMR.
text:
“How to Be a Modern Scientist” by Jeff Leek
This book is an amazing book that describes the effect of artificial intelligence and novel strategies on recent scientists. Multiple principles have been presented in a sample and interesting way. I will summarize some of these principles in the following blog.
Contradictory to the old protocol where we see the research results without any transparency and openness in research, the modern scientist is recommended to share their data, code, and methodologies to facilitate reproducibility and collaboration of the research such a way would help others to continue to discover a new era. The researcher also advised adopting new tools, methodologies, and different environments. Collaboration with experts from different fields to address complex problems can lead to innovative solutions. Delivering the research findings to the public or scientific community using a clear and accessible language with various media formats to facilitate message delivery. Advocate for the importance of science and evidence-based decision-making in society. Engage with policymakers and the public to promote understanding and support for scientific research. Lastly, try to use the media to self-advertise your progress.
The book took 4-6 hours to finish. I would recommend any new scientist to read before starting his journey.

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
Welcome to my website!
I am an American board-certified in oral maxillofacial radiologist. I am working in oral maxillofacial radiology department at CWRU School of Dental Medicine. Currently, I am a first year PhD student in Clinical Translation Science program in School of Medicine at Case Western Reserve University. My research interests lie at the intersection of cardiovascular disease and incidental findings in Cone beam Tomography.
On this website, you will find educational background, teaching and clinical experience, and my CV. On my CV I presented some of my published works. You will also find news and updates on my current situation. I invite you to explore my website and learn more about my life’s work. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.
